intro: Viola purpurea, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers have five petals, with the upper petal often marked by a distinctive violet or purple spot. Viola purpurea is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in woodlands, meadows, and along stream banks.
